TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ServiceEndpoint extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the endpoint for a service that allows clients of the service to find and communicate with the service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The service endpoint contains the information about the address, binding, contract, and behavior required by a client to find and interact with the service at this endpoint.
## Examples [!code-csharp[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/cs/program.cs#0)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#0](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/vb/program.vb#0)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the endpoint address for the service endpoint.
Docs.value: The that specifies the location of the service endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.ListenUri%2A> at which the service endpoint listens is provided by <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress.Uri%2A> of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> returned by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Address%2A>.
## Examples The following example shows how to add a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> to an existing <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost> and display the address property:
[!code-csharp[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/cs/program.cs#3)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/vb/program.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Behaviors As KeyedByTypeCollection(Of IEndpointBehavior)

Docs.summary: Gets the behaviors for the service endpoint.
Docs.value: The of type that contains the behaviors specified for the service endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The type of behavior that is accessible from the description hierarchy is scoped to the specific level. From the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> is accessible.
If you want access to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior> associated with an endpoint, you can obtain the contact for the endpoint using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Contract%2A> property. Then call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.Behaviors%2A> property to obtain the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection%601> of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior> objects associated with the endpoint.
## Examples The following code demonstrates how to add a custom endpoint behavior and then access that behavior.
[!code-csharp[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/cs/snippet.cs#4)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/vb/snippet.vb#4)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the binding for the service endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The binding for an endpoint can also be specified in the configuration file in the [<bindings>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/bindings.md) element.

Docs.summary: Gets the contract for the service endpoint.
Docs.value: The that specifies the contract for the service endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each service endpoint has a unique contract. From the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription>, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescriptionCollection> for the methods contained in the contract can be accessed using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.Operations%2A> property.
## Examples [!code-csharp[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/cs/snippet.cs#5)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/vb/snippet.vb#5)]

Docs.value: The at which the service endpoint listens. The default value is provided by of the returned by .

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets or sets how the transport handles the URI that is provided for the service to listen on.
Docs.value: The for the service endpoint. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ListenUriMode> is used to determine how the transport handles the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.ListenUri%2A>.
## Examples [!code-csharp[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/cs/snippet.cs#5)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/vb/snippet.vb#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Name : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the service endpoint.
Docs.value: The name the service endpoint. The default value is the concatenation of the binding name and the contract description name. For example, +'_' + .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Services may have multiple endpoints, so the endpoint <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Name%2A> is distinct from the name of the service. The service name is accessed using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Name%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > When accessed from the service, this property is populated by the <endpoint name="`endpointName`"\> configuration element. When accessed on the client, this property is `null`. When the property getter is called (again on the client) it populates this property with a default value based on the contract and binding.
## Examples [!code-csharp[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/cs/snippet.cs#5)] [!code-vb[S_UE_ServiceEndpoint#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_serviceendpoint/vb/snippet.vb#5)]
